It's Here! I Got My Copy!
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher Card & Adventure Video Games: Monster Rancher Hop-A-Bout Archive (PSOne): It's Here! I Got My Copy!
By Lisa Shock on Tuesday, November 28, 2000 - 03:35 pm:

Babbage's/Gamestop/Software Etc. got it in today. A longer report tonight!

By Lisa Shock on Tuesday, November 28, 2000 - 08:13 pm:

Let's see....the music and overall feel is similar to the Bust-A-Move series of games or the Japanese Puyo-Puyo games - light, cute, and perky. The game itself involves choosing a character (The monsters are clearly spun off the TV show.) on a pogo-stick and having him jump across a field of squares. Your viewpoint is about 3 feet behind the character's shoulders. The puzzle part involves steering your character around the board so he doesn't fall off, and to pick up extras from special squares. The gameplay is quite a bit like Intelligent Qube, but from a much closer vantage point. There's a fun create your own board mode, which I played with briefly. Overall, this is lighthearted fun!

By Petit-Trot on Wednesday, November 29, 2000 - 10:43 am:

So, it's a glorified Q-Bert?

By Lisa Shock on Wednesday, November 29, 2000 - 12:34 pm:

Um, sort of, you're hopping on a flat field though. There are also holes where you can fall off into space, and it's fun hearing the monsters cry out as they fall to their deaths....

By Carl Carlisle on Wednesday, November 29, 2000 - 11:41 pm:

Huh? What?
We get to sadistically send them hurling through space, and relish their anguished cries until they become pavement pancakes?

Where can I get a copy?

By Lisa Shock on Thursday, November 30, 2000 - 08:39 am:

Gamestop has it!

Also, just a reminder, it does make a Naga/Gali in MR2, since several people have complained of having no way to get a Naga.

By Petit-Trot on Thursday, November 30, 2000 - 06:11 pm:

What are the monsters you can use?

By Lisa Shock on Thursday, November 30, 2000 - 11:46 pm:

In practice mode there's Mocchi, Golem, Suezo and Hare. I haven't gone further than that yet.
